body:
https://github.com/helm/helm/pull/6243

Need to place all of crds under `crds/` folder

@anikin-aa A re-architecture of CRD support was done in v3.  The background to this is documented in: https://github.com/helm/helm/issues/5871

#6243 is an implementation of the proposal. 

There is a documentation issue open in https://github.com/helm/helm-www/issues/301.

Did you mange to get this working using the `crds` directory?

> helm template . --kubeconfig /home/me/.kube/config fails with next error:
>Error: apiVersion "apiextensions.k8s.io/v1beta1" in crd.yaml is not available

Regarding the above helm template error see https://github.com/helm/helm/issues/6505

> Did you mange to get this working using the crds directory?

@hickeyma Yep, its working under `crds/` directory. thx !

But now i'm facing similar error, but for my Custom Resource:
```
Error: apiVersion "test.com/v1" in customresource.yaml is not available
```
@sidharthsurana, thanks for pointing out. `--validate` works for me

issue.title: Skip api version checks when install action is configured in client mode only

labels.name: size/M
labels.description: Denotes a PR that changes 30-99 lines, ignoring generated files.

labels.name: v3.x
labels.description: Issues and Pull Requests related to the major version v3

issue.body:
closes #6505

Note: Reopening #6701 after switch from `dev-v3` to `master` base branch. Discussion started in that PR.

--- 

Original PR content

<!--  Thanks for sending a pull request!  Here are some tips for you:
1. Make sure to read the Contributing Guide before submitting your PR: https://github.com/helm/helm/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md
2. If this PR closes another issue, add 'closes #<issue number>' somewhere in the PR summary. GitHub will automatically close that issue when this PR gets merged. Alternatively, adding 'refs #<issue number>' will not close the issue, but help provide the reviewer more context.-->

**What this PR does / why we need it**:

Hi there,

With helm 3, when an install action is run in client-mode only (`install` without `--validate`) and if your chart contains custom resources you end up hitting error that look like that.

```
apiVersion "example.com/v1" in my-app/templates/cutoms.yaml is not available
```

This PR attempt to workaround the issue by skipping entirely the check if we are in client mode as we can't be aware of any custom resource definition present on the remote cluster in advance as we don't interact with it in such mode.

Thoughts?

**Special notes for your reviewer**:

The error hit is similar to the one described in #6680 

**If applicable**:
- [ ] this PR contains documentation
- [x] this PR contains unit tests
- [ ] this PR has been tested for backwards compatibility

issue.title: storageos-operator chart not working with helm3
issue.body:
Attempting to deploy storageos on an EKS cluster with helm v3.0.0 fails.

Please find logs output below:
```
maeg9@test ~/Documents/git/k8s/storageos -  (29_storage-os-implementation) $ helm3 install release-name storageos/storageos-operator --namespace storageos
manifest_sorter.go:175: info: skipping unknown hook: "crd-install"
manifest_sorter.go:175: info: skipping unknown hook: "crd-install"
manifest_sorter.go:175: info: skipping unknown hook: "crd-install"
manifest_sorter.go:175: info: skipping unknown hook: "crd-install"
Error: unable to build kubernetes objects from release manifest: unable to recognize "": no matches for kind "StorageOSCluster" in version "storageos.com/v1"
```


Could you recommend what is best course of action in this case please? 

Would templating the chart locally and apply to my cluster work fine or is this chart dependant on Helm hooks (I am referring to the crd and post-delete ones)?

issue.title: [NTH v2] Should place CRD (without templating) in crds directory for Helm 3

repository.name: aws-node-termination-handler
repository.description: Gracefully handle EC2 instance shutdown within Kubernetes

issue.body:
**Describe the bug**

Thanks @stevehipwell  for pointing this out. See previous discussion [here](https://github.com/aws/aws-node-termination-handler/pull/707#issuecomment-1283704197)

TL;DR Helm 3 wants CRDs in a `crds/` directory[[1](https://github.com/helm/helm/issues/6665#issuecomment-541720338)], and discourages templating in CRDs [[2](https://github.com/helm/helm/issues/6930)].
